job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviours, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Requirements

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviours, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.
  • Candidates must align with 2Base’s structured thinking, clarity-driven culture, and transformation of the BA function.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com
summary: Senior Business Analyst translates complex business needs into structured functional requirements, collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure testable, developer-ready outputs. Requires 4+ years of experience in SaaS environments with strong analytical and documentation skills.

job_description:
Role Overview

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs
  • Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented
  • Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation
  • Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them
  • Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams
  • Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams
  • Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle
  • Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements
  • Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation
  • Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines
  • Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details
  • Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation
  • Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements

Required Skills and Experience

  • 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles
  • Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation
  • Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control
  • Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly
  • Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes
  • Experience with project management systems and documentation tools
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel
  • Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
  • 1 to 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

How to Apply

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com
summary: The Business Analyst translates business needs into structured documentation, ensuring clarity and alignment across teams. Requires 1-4 years of experience in BRD/SRS creation and strong communication skills.

In this role, you will drive revenue by generating leads, building client relationships, and managing the full sales cycle for IT services and digital solutions. This individual contributor position requires end-to-end ownership of sales processes, from prospecting to closure. If you thrive in a tech-driven, growth-focused environment, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities - Identify and generate qualified leads via outbound channels, referrals, and market research. - Drive new business opportunities for web, mobile, and enterprise software development services. - Manage the complete sales cycle: lead qualification, client communication, requirement analysis, proposal preparation, pricing, negotiation, and closure. - Propose tailored IT and digital transformation solutions aligned with client business objectives. - Build relationships with key decision-makers (Founders, CXOs, Product Owners). - Collaborate with delivery, design, and marketing teams to create compelling proposals and presentations. - Maintain CRM records and provide sales forecasts/reports. - Represent the company at networking events and client meetings to enhance visibility. - Meet/exceed monthly/quarterly revenue targets consistently.

Requirements - Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in education/experience (IT/CS/BCA/B-Tech/CS/EC/MBA/Diploma preferred). - 2-5 years of B2B sales experience in IT services/digital solutions. - Proven ability to manage sales pipelines and close deals independently. - Strong knowledge of software development services (web/mobile apps, SaaS, enterprise solutions). - Experience with international clients preferred. - Familiarity with CRM systems (Zoho, HubSpot, Salesforce) and outbound tools (LinkedIn Sales Navigator). - Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills. - Ability to work autonomously and own sales targets. - Strategic thinker who understands client pain points and positions solutions effectively.

Experience & Education - 2-5 years in sales/business development. - Bachelor’s/BSc. IT/CS/BCA/B-Tech/CS/EC/MBA/Diploma in CS/IT. - Certifications in sales, digital marketing, or business consulting are a plus.

Contact: Email your resume to careers@2basetechnologies.com.

job_description:
Senior DevSecOps Engineer

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and foster a secure-by-design culture. You will collaborate with engineering, product, and leadership teams to ensure systems, applications, and cloud environments are secure, reliable, and future-ready.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct security risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and execute mitigation plans.
  • Architect and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance and governance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture, ensuring secure design and development practices.
  • Monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats, incidents, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures across AWS, Azure, or GCP for scalable, compliant deployments.
  • Build and secure containerized environments with Docker and Kubernetes using enforced security baselines.
  • Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems for infrastructure and applications.
  • Improve system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance across critical workloads.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development, automation, and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, process improvements, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security, performance, and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with strong security exposure.
  • Hands-on CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions).
  • Strong expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP with secure architecture focus.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Networking expertise (LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers).
  • Knowledge of security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Experience with monitoring tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM).
  • Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash, Shell).
  • Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication and collaboration abilities to influence engineering teams.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Diploma/B.Tech/MCA in IT, CS, or related fields.
  • Experience in SOC operations or SIEM/SOAR tools.
  • Certifications: AWS Security/DevOps Engineer – Professional, CKS, CEH, CompTIA Security+.

Benefits

  • Growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Lead cybersecurity and infrastructure automation for secure cloud environments. Requires 4–8 years of experience with Terraform, Ansible, and cloud platforms.

job_description:
AI CoE Lead

We are seeking a visionary and execution-driven AI Centre of Excellence (CoE) Lead to establish and scale our artificial intelligence capabilities within the healthcare domain. You will act as the founder and chief architect of our AI practice, owning the strategy, platform, products, and delivery from inception to enterprise and global scale. This role blends deep technical leadership, healthcare domain expertise, and strong business ownership.

Key Responsibilities

AI Platform & Ecosystem Design - Define and build an enterprise-ready AI platform with modular architecture and reusable components. - Design and oversee multi-model orchestration, including LLMOps, MLOps, vector databases, and RAG pipelines. - Ensure scalability, reliability, observability, and cost efficiency across all AI services. - Establish platform standards for APIs, integrations, security, and monitoring.

Healthcare Product Strategy & Roadmap - Develop a clear AI product vision aligned to hospital and healthcare system needs. - Identify and prioritize use cases such as clinical decision support, revenue cycle automation, operational efficiency, and patient monitoring. - Drive an API-first, integration-friendly approach for EHRs and healthcare systems. - Own the roadmap from proof-of-concept to enterprise-grade products.

Value Articulation & Stakeholder Engagement - Translate complex AI capabilities into clear business value and ROI for healthcare leaders. - Create solution frameworks and outcome-based success metrics for customers. - Engage directly with C-suite stakeholders (CIO, CMIO, CFO, CEO) to shape adoption and investment decisions. - Support sales and growth teams with AI vision, demos, and executive-level narratives.

End-to-End Delivery & Execution - Lead the full lifecycle of AI initiatives: ideation, PoCs, MVPs, enterprise rollout, and global expansion. - Ensure delivery velocity while maintaining clinical safety, compliance, and quality. - Act as the escalation point for critical technical, delivery, or customer challenges. - Maintain hands-on involvement through reviews, key design decisions, and customer interactions.

Responsible AI, Security & Compliance - Embed Security-by-Design and Responsible AI principles across all platforms and products. - Ensure compliance with healthcare regulations and standards including HIPAA, FHIR, and PHI handling. - Define governance for model risk, bias, explainability, and auditability. - Work closely with legal, compliance, and security teams to meet clinical and regulatory requirements.

Business Growth & Partnerships - Own budgets, investment planning, and commercial outcomes for AI initiatives. - Convert AI use cases into sustainable revenue streams and long-term contracts. - Build strategic partnerships with cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP), AI model vendors, and healthcare system integrators. - Represent the AI CoE externally with partners, customers, and industry forums.

Team Building & CoE Leadership - Hire, mentor, and lead a high-performing team of ML engineers, data engineers, platform engineers, and solution experts. - Define the AI CoE operating model, best practices, and delivery standards. - Foster a culture of trust, innovation, ownership, and continuous learning.

Required Skills

  • Advanced degree in Computer Science, AI/ML, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • Solid experience in senior leadership roles across product engineering, platforms, or technology-led businesses.
  • Proven experience building and scaling AI/ML or SaaS platforms from early stage to enterprise adoption.
  • Strong hands-on knowledge of Generative AI, LLMs, vector databases, cloud architecture, and enterprise security.
  • Deep understanding of healthcare systems, workflows, EHR integrations, and data privacy requirements.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Preferred Skills (Good to have)

  • Experience working with hospital networks or large healthcare providers.
  • Prior ownership of P&L, budgets, or revenue targets for technology products.
  • Exposure to global healthcare markets and multi-region deployments.
  • Experience defining Responsible AI frameworks in regulated industries.

Experience

12-15 years

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@cabotsolutions.com.
